Package dnl.node

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • dnl.node.Node
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Node>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Diverge, Merge, PedSignal, Series, Signal, Sink, Source, StopSign
    public abstract class Node
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Node>
    This represents a node in the network. This is an abstract class: key methods are not implemented, and must be implemented in subclasses. These depend on the specific intersection model.

    • Field Detail

      • pred

        public Link pred

      • cost

        public double cost

    • Constructor Detail

      • Node

        public Node​(int id,
            double longitude,
            double latitude,
            double elevation)
        Constructs the Node with the given id, latitude, longitude, and elevation. The incoming and outgoing sets of Links will be updated automatically as Links are constructed.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of this Node
        longitude - the longitude portion of the location
        latitude - the latitude portion of the location
        elevation - the elevation (in ft)

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public abstract void reset()
        Resets this Node to start a new dynamic network loading

      • getElevation

        public double getElevation()
        Returns:
        the elevation (in ft)

      • getLatitude

        public double getLatitude()
        Returns:
        the latitude.

      • getLongitude

        public double getLongitude()
        Returns:
        the longitude.

      • storeTurningProportion

        public void storeTurningProportion​(Link i,
                                   Link j,
                                   double p)
        Used when constructing the Node: adjusts the turning proportion from Link i to Link j. Turning proportions must add to 1 for all incoming Links.

      • getTurningProportions

        public java.util.Map<Link,​java.util.Map<Link,​java.lang.Double>> getTurningProportions()
        Returns:
        the Map of turning proportions

      • clearTurningProportions

        public void clearTurningProportions()
        Deletes all stored turning proportions. This method is used for DTA.

      • getTurningProp

        public double getTurningProp​(Link i,
                             Link j)
        Returns:
        the proportion of flow leaving Link i turning onto Link j. The value is between 0 and 1.

      • getIncoming

        public java.util.List<Link> getIncoming()
        Returns:
        the set of incoming Links

      • getOutgoing

        public java.util.List<Link> getOutgoing()
        Returns:
        the set of outgoing Links

      • addLink

        public void addLink​(Link l)
        Adds the Link to the incoming or outgoing sets of links, as appropriate

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Returns:
        the id for this Node

      • step

        public abstract void step()
        This is called every time step. For the Node class, step() should move flow between incoming and outgoing Links.

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        This is called every time step, after step() has been called for all Nodes and Links. It can be used to finish any updating work that could not occur during step(). DO NOT use this to update the internal state of Links. This is used to update the state of this Node.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Node rhs)
        Used to sort Nodes by id.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Node>

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Used for hashing. You can ignore it.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the id of the Node
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
